Because there aren't huge conventions and the shops are not located in major walkways, the lines for coffee in the morning aren't too bad compared to some of the other hotels, but the baristas seem slow and don't have a good system as people behind me got drinks before me.

That said, i think they are best with their sandwiches.  I highly recommend the Italian sandwich toasted if you are looking to not eat in a restaurant in the hotel.

My only beef is that the second floor location closes early.  They also have good gelato!!

East coast time in the west coast a PIA , East coast time on the west coast on the Sunday where the time changes for spring Brutal.  So i set put to find some coffee that will help me become a marginally norma human being, hotel breakfast coffee was not going to cut it. Va Bene is located on 2nd and 1 st floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel. Since I was in the west tower I picked first floor lobby. Va Bene bless your soul for making an espresso based wake ip call and putting in it a to go cup for me. However i refuse to pay 7 dollars for the large one I am needy not desperate!!! So i opted for the small Latte still 5 dollars. I also tried their chocolate croissant because really what goes better with latte? Trick question nothing does.

I love the hazelnut latte here! There is almost always a line, but they are really efficient and move the line fast. 

I only had the hazelnut latte here, but they have tons of options and ice cream too!

The three-stars is only based off of the spinach and egg breakfast sandwich I got from here. Swung through here on my way through the Cosmopolitan to grab a bite on the go. They had two breakfast sandwiches in the display, so I opted for the spinach and egg $13 dollars. 

The sandwich was served on sourdough bread with a square shaped egg with some spinach cooked in. I am definity not picky at all when it comes to food so it was not bad but nothing 4 or 5 star worthy of writing. They warm up the sandwich prior to serving to make everything warm and crunchy. 

If you're in a pinch or want to grab 'n go this place is that check-in-the-box for a quick refuel on coffee or snack.

Not a fan of italian pasta dishes, but i sure love their sandwiches!!

This italian coffee/gelato bar/shop is just around the corner near Cosmo's Marquee. It's easily passed by since it just a tiny store between restaurants and shops however. This place is IT!

I went here for a quick dinner prior to partying @ the Marquee. Service is decent, waiting time is not even there. Staff is nice, place is petite, nothing fancy, but then the food is delicious. Their sandwiches, as simple as they get are awesomely mouth watering. Don't have the appetite for ice cream but they're gelato looks yummy though i haven't tried it. 

Will come back here for a decent bang for your buck quick grub, if you don't wanna fall out of line to Marquee!!!!

Love that they serve Illy coffee/espresso here. But the service and drink quality can be a mixed bag, with occasional sloppiness and rudeness from the manager on down. I am disappointed that they stopped carrying the Bombassant, their version of a cronut. That was an amazing pastry. All will be forgiven if they'd bring it back.

Open early and closes late. A very convenient coffee shop that serves panini, coffee, and pastries on the go. This is a great place for a quick bite before heading out. I had the chocolate muffin, nutella swirl croissaint, egg spinach panini, italian panini, lattes, and strawberry banana smoothie. It's about $60 total for all the above listed, but it's decent, above average good food. We are usually on the run to drive out to hike and this is the perfect place for quick breakfast.
Not that great:( very pricey! $40 for 2 small coffees 2 breakfast sandwiches, what do you do no Starbucks Cosmo:(  have to go there and pay the price! Coffee was very weak!

Grape Fruit Salad!! Italian Breakfast Sandwich!! The Coffee!! All delicious! I ate the GF salad everyday! Yea it's pricey BUT so is this hotel.. So worth it! If your worried about the extra few $$. It's not for you. 

I still think about the GF salad daily. :)

I came here at some awful hour of the day and was pleased they were open. I looked forward to the illy espresso and people watching, but was a little shell shocked when I saw the price for my latte. A medium latte came to $7. 

I paid the $7 and was very pleased with my drink. It was perfectly prepared and I had a nice conversation with a woman behind the counter. 

There were plenty of people on staff and busy for 515 in the morning. It was clear they were having fun with their job and were happy to be at their job. 

Although it's pricey, it comes with the territory. I enjoyed stopping by, being involved with the energy of the baristas, people watching in the Cosmo, and sipping my expensive latte.

I didn't go into the actual restaurant but I greatly appreciated the fact that they had a little coffee cart right by the elevators on the second floor so that I could run down in my pjs and grab a couple of lattes and pastry to bring up to the room.  On a related note, what's up with the Cosmo not providing coffee makers in their rooms?  In our suite, we had a fridge, a microwave, a dishwasher (I'm being serious) but no coffee pot. WTF?!

Hands down the best croissant I've ever had. So fresh and flaky on the outside, soft and airy on the inside. And it's fresh regardless if you have it at 6am or 9pm. Trust me I had a few during my stay. Coffee is good too, a little overpriced but you get free refills for the rest of the day when you keep your receipt, why not!

Impossible to get my coffee right even after returning over and over. I used to work on the property so I would come in often and even after a pricey coffee that included a discount it still would not live up to Wynn's standards. Never again.

Great oasis for a quick coffee break. Since it's located literally in the casinos there's no relaxing tables and chairs so be mindful of that. 
Food is decent. Loved the largest Palmier I've ever had. Wish there's a vegan menu.

My iced latte was mediocre and overpriced, I also had their version of a Cronut and that was pretty good, But my gripe here is with the staff, who are INCREDIBLY RUDE! Service matters, because it can ruin an experience no matter how good food can be. Everyone in the hotel has been gracious until my boyfriend tried to order a chai latte with soy milk and an add shot. The cashier kept interrupting him when he was asked to repeat his order not letting him finish his sentence because he was confused about the add shot request and spoke in a condescending irritated tone and practically rolled his eyes at us!   Service was so bad I felt compelled to speak to the manager because I was so appalled at how we were being treated and wanted to prevent others from experiencing this, unfortunately they were unavailable. The baristas saw this happening and I could tell they were uncomfortable with what was going on. 

I'll save my caffeine fix for Starbucks instead next time, sorry Cosmo you hired whack people at this place.
